intro: Brenesia costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican brenesia, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native habitat.
